title: Bank of Mexico Minutes Show Heightened Inflation Concerns
sub_head: The central bank expects inflation to remain above target well into 2023
body:
Mexican central bankers focused on rising consumer prices and inflation expectations in deciding last month to raise interest rates for a third consecutive meeting, minutes of the meeting showed Thursday.
The five-member board of governors voted 4-1 on Sept. 30 to increase the overnight interest-rate target by a quarter percentage point to 4.75%, following increases of the same size in June and August.
